H4910.def: = state in which humans are similar in shape, behavior or experience to others

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H3905.def: = action by which someone presses oneself against another object

H3665.def: = action by which humans show a low estimate of their own importance, usually before a deity

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H6471.def: = the lower part of the leg beyond the ankle, on which humans or animals stand and with which they walk

H5337.def: = causative action by which humans remove an object from a situation where it could be damaged

H4784.def: = action by which humans reject the authority of a ruler or deity to which they had formerly been subjected

H4355.def: = process by which a flat object bulges downwards through weight, pressure, or lack of strength

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H1285.def: = a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses

H5162.def: = causative action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H7356.def: = state in which humans feel compassion for others, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well-being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action

H7617.def: = a person or group that has been forcibly carried off into slavery or exile

H3467.def: = action by which humans or deities help themselves in a (difficult) situation

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H6908.def: = action by which humans or animals come together as a group for a common purpose

H3034.def: literally: to confess (God's) name; hence: = action by which humans publicly admit their own shortcomings before God, or the shortcomings of the people they represent

H6944.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H7623.def: = state in which humans think positively about (other) humans or events

H8416.def: = action by which humans express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to deities about who they are and what they do

H1288.def: = causative action by which humans cause animals to fall on their knees

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H543.def: = marker expressing a speaker's solemn confirmation of the truth of a statement

H1984.def: = process by which an object emits or reflects light; ≈ regarded as awesome

H3050.def: = short form of {L:יהוה<SDBH:יהוה>}, only found in poetic texts
